Agile: Movement Bonus - Every ship in your fleet has +1 movement.
Arrogant: Extra Action for Most Ships - If at the start of your turn you have more ships on the map than any other player, take an extra action.
Clever: Controlled Modification - Whenever you would roll a ship, choose the ship number instead.
Warlike: Extra Action for Destruction - When you destroy 1 or more enemy ships on your turn, you gain 1 extra action for that turn.
Brilliant: Research Bonus - Add 2 to your research automatically at the start of your turn.
Cerebral: Reduce Dominance for Research - Once per turn as a free action, you may reduce your dominance by 1 and gain 3 research.
Conformist: Extra Action for Matching Ships - If 2 or more of your ships on the map have the same number at the start of your turn, take 1 extra action.
Cruel: Force Opponent to Reroll - When you attach or defend, you can choose to have your opponent reroll once.
Curious: Bonus peaceful move - At the end of each turn, you get 1 extra move action for free (you cannot use it to attack).
Dangerous: Destroy your Attacker - When you defend, before players roll combat dice, you can decide to destroy both ships (there is no dominance effect).
Energetic: Move more than Once - your ships may move/attack more than once per turn (each one counts as an action).
Ferocious: Combat Bonus - Subtract 1 from your combat roll when attacking or defending.
Flexible: Adjust a Ship - Once per turn, you may change one of your ship dice up or down by 1 as a free action.
Stealthy: Deploy to Isolated Spaces - You have the option of deploying to any space that is not directly adjacent to another ship.
Resourceful: Sacrifice your Ship to Gain 1 Action - Once per turn, take a ship from the map to your scrapyard, reroll it, and gain 1 action for that turn.
Eager: Free Deployment - The deploy action does not use up one of your actions.
Relentless: Reroll in Combat - When you attack or defend, you can roll again once after your opponent rolls.
Ingenious: Construct from Corners - You can choose to have ships diagonally adjacent to planets count towards cube construction.
Intelligent: Flexible Construction - You can construct on a planet with an orbital value 1 higher or lower than the planet's number.
Righteous: Irreducible Dominance - Your dominance is not reduced when one of your ships is destroyed.
Nomadic: Transport between Planets - Once per turn, spend an action to relocate one of your ships in orbital position to an orbital position on a directly adjacent planet.
Stubborn: Strong Defense - When you are attacked, ties go in your favor and you destroy your attacker if you win (and gain dominance).
Plundering: Destruction is Research - If you destroy one or more enemy ships on your turn, increase your research by 2
Precocious: Rapid Advancement - Gain an advance card when research = 4 or higher (instead of 6).
Scrappy: Reroll your Die Rolls - On your turn, you may rueroll all die rolls (ship or combat) a second time.
Rational: Combat rolls fixed at 3 - Instead of rolling for combat, all of your combat die rolls are considered to be 3.
Cunning: Extra Ship Ability - Once per turn, you may use one of your ship's abilities a second time as a free action.
Strategic: Combat Support Bonus - Any of your ships directly adjacent to another one of your ships receives a -2 to every combat roll.
Tactical: Bonus Short Move - Once per turn as a free action, move 1 of your ships to a directly adjacent space (you can attack with the move).
Tyrannical: Reduce Research for Dominance - Once per turn as a free action, you may reduce your research by 1 and gain 1 dominance.
Ravenous: Dominance Amplification - Gain 2 dominance (total) when you destroy an enemy ship, and lose 2 dominance when one of your ship is destroyed
Expansion: Add a Ship to your Fleet - Immediately roll an expansion ship & either deploy it or put it in your scrapyard.
Reorganization: Immediately Reroll any or all of your Ships - For each of the rerolled ships, either deploy it or put it in your scrapyard.
Relocation: Immediately Move a Cube - Move another players cube to a planet without that player's cube that has an open space (you can't move a player's initial cube)
Aggression: Immediately Add 2 to Dominance
Momentum: Take a Bonus 2-Action Turn - Immediately take another turn, with 2 actions instead of 3 actions.
Sabotage: Remove Command Cards - All other players must immediately choose and discard a single Command card.
